intro: Desbordesia insignis, commonly known as the golden star cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has a cylindrical stem with spines and is adapted to survive in dry, hot environments. It produces small, rounded fruits that contain edible seeds. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in desert gardens.
